artifacts.summary: Root cause analysis identifying Neovim autoread/checktime mechanism reloading compose buffer with full MIME headers; recommends disabling buffer-local autoread
Additional research identifying race condition between autosave and FileChangedShell causing data loss during email composition

Identified critical argument bug in HimalayaSaveDraft command passing boolean instead of buffer number, plus integrated solution combining argument fix with autoread disable for all three reported issues
3-phase implementation plan fixing argument bug and disabling autoread for Himalaya compose buffers
Implementation summary with details of all changes made

active_projects.completion_summary: Fixed three Himalaya email composition issues: corrected save_draft argument bug that caused 'No draft associated with buffer' errors, disabled buffer-local autoread to prevent disruptive header format changes during autosave, and eliminated data loss race condition. Total 4 lines changed across 2 files.

artifacts.summary: Research findings showing gH works but ? is standard; footer has incorrect keybinding; 3 files need updates
4-phase implementation plan for fixing Himalaya sidebar help display inaccuracies
Implementation summary with verification results

active_projects.completion_summary: Fixed Himalaya sidebar help display to use ? instead of gH across all contexts. Updated folder_help.lua help section, simplified email_list.lua footer to simple ?:help, and updated all show_help() messages in commands/ui.lua. Both keybindings still work, but only ? is now documented.

artifacts.summary: Research report documenting the nil value error cause and recommended fix using existing compose_email function
2-phase plan: Phase 1 fixes HimalayaWrite command to use compose_email() like sidebar 'e' key; Phase 2 verifies identical behavior
Implementation summary documenting the fix and verification

active_projects.completion_summary: Fixed nil value error in HimalayaWrite command by replacing broken function calls with main.compose_email(). The <leader>mw keymap now behaves identically to pressing 'e' in the Himalaya sidebar.

artifacts.summary: Research report on himalaya thread grouping: CLI capabilities, JWZ algorithm, implementation strategy
5-phase implementation plan for Himalaya email thread grouping with subject-based grouping and expand/collapse UI
Implementation summary with all changes and verification results

active_projects.completion_summary: Implemented email thread grouping in Himalaya sidebar. Created threading.lua module for subject normalization and thread indexing. Added expand/collapse keybindings (Tab, zo/zc, zR/zM) and :HimalayaThreadingToggle command. Threads display with [N] count indicator, grouping Re:/Fwd:/AW: replies together.

artifacts.summary: Research report with root cause analysis, existing safeguards review, and phased implementation recommendations
3-phase plan: request validation, debouncing, and verification testing
Implementation summary with technical details and verification results

active_projects.completion_summary: Fixed race condition in Himalaya sidebar page counter by implementing request validation with generation IDs and 50ms debouncing for cache-miss navigation. Stale async responses are discarded, preventing page content from mismatching the displayed page number during rapid <C-d>/<C-u> presses.

artifacts.summary: Research report documenting cache-related pagination display bug with three fix options
3-phase plan: extract header generation function, modify render_cached_page to regenerate header, comprehensive testing
Implementation summary with verification details and technical documentation

active_projects.completion_summary: Fixed Himalaya sidebar page counter display bug. Page counter now correctly shows page 2/3/4/5 when navigating with C-d instead of staying at page 1. Solution regenerates header on cache hit while preserving cached email content for performance.

artifacts.summary: Research report documenting OAuth2 token expiration as root cause and fix procedure
3-phase implementation plan for fixing Gmail OAuth2 authentication
Research report documenting root cause (himalaya CLI omits INBOX), code locations, and implementation approach with priority-sorted folder list
2-phase implementation plan for fixing himalaya folder selection with INBOX guarantee and priority sorting
Implementation summary with verification results

active_projects.completion_summary: Fixed himalaya sidebar folder selection to include INBOX and sort folders by usage priority. Added INBOX guarantee check (inserts INBOX if missing from CLI results) and priority-based sorting (INBOX, Sent, Drafts, All_Mail, Trash first, then alphabetical) to both get_folders() and scan_maildir_folders() functions.

artifacts.summary: Root cause analysis identifying CLI version incompatibility: envelope get command does not exist in himalaya v1.1.0 and send must be message send
4-phase plan covering send command fix, message read helper, get_email_by_id update, and integration testing
Implementation summary with verification results

active_projects.completion_summary: Fixed Himalaya email client integration for himalaya CLI v1.1.0. Updated send_email() to use 'message send' command with stdin piping, replaced non-existent 'envelope get' with 'message read' in get_email_by_id(), and added parse_message_read_result() helper to extract email data for reply/forward operations.

artifacts.summary: Research report documenting root cause analysis of nil value error and fix recommendations for HimalayaSend and HimalayaDiscard commands
2-phase implementation plan for fixing nil value errors in Himalaya email commands
Implementation summary with verification results

active_projects.completion_summary: Fixed two nil value errors in Himalaya email commands module by correcting function names: main.send_email() to main.send_current_email() and composer.close() to main.close_without_saving().

artifacts.summary: Analysis of three Himalaya errors: missing is_composing function, folder table vs string type mismatch, and reply/forward email ID lookup failures
4-phase implementation plan for fixing Himalaya email command errors
Implementation summary with verification results

active_projects.completion_summary: Fixed Himalaya email plugin errors: added is_composing() wrapper function, fixed folder:lower() nil errors by properly extracting folder names from table structures, and enhanced reply/forward commands with detailed diagnostic messages.

artifacts.summary: Research report identifying root cause (cond evaluated once) and solution (buffer-local wk.add)
4-phase implementation plan for fixing which-key conditional mappings via buffer-local registration
Implementation summary with verification results

active_projects.completion_summary: Fixed which-key conditional mappings by replacing cond-based registration with buffer-local registration. Compose keymaps (<leader>me, <leader>md, <leader>mq) now appear when composing emails, and preview keymaps appear in himalaya-email buffers.

artifacts.summary: Analysis of himalaya keybinding architecture identifying <leader>me conflict and recommending removal of redundant email actions subgroup
6-phase implementation plan covering which-key global changes, email preview mappings, sidebar/list keybindings, and help updates
Implementation summary documenting all keybinding changes and verification results

active_projects.completion_summary: Refactored himalaya keybindings to eliminate <leader>me subgroup conflict. Changed <leader>ma to <leader>mA for switch account, added email preview <leader>m mappings (reply, forward, delete, archive, compose, search), updated sidebar and email list keymaps so c=change folder and e=compose, and updated all help messages.

artifacts.summary: Research report identifying root cause (filetype mismatch, dual keymap paths) and recommending which-key.lua centralization with is_mail() condition
3-phase implementation plan adding <leader>me/md/mq to which-key.lua with cond=is_mail
Implementation summary with verification results

active_projects.completion_summary: Moved compose buffer keymaps (<leader>me, <leader>md, <leader>mq) from config/ui.lua to which-key.lua using cond = is_mail. Keymaps now properly appear in which-key popup only when composing emails.

artifacts.summary: Research report detailing why cond doesn't work for conditional popup display, the maintainer-recommended solution using buffer-local keymaps, and implementation plan extending config/ui.lua setup_compose_keymaps()
3-phase implementation plan for fixing compose buffer which-key mappings
Implementation summary documenting the fix

active_projects.completion_summary: Fixed compose buffer which-key mappings not appearing by switching from cond-based registration (which only controls activation) to buffer-local keymaps using vim.keymap.set with buffer option. Added <leader>me, <leader>md, <leader>mq to setup_compose_keymaps() and removed redundant which-key registrations.

artifacts.summary: Research report documenting synmaxcol limitation, treesitter configuration gaps, and recommended fixes for TypeScript syntax highlighting on long lines
4-phase implementation plan for fixing syntax highlighting on long lines in TypeScript files
Implementation summary with verification results

active_projects.completion_summary: Fixed syntax highlighting interruption on long TypeScript lines by adding TypeScript/TSX treesitter parsers, creating ftplugin overrides to disable synmaxcol limit, and enabling snacks.nvim bigfile module for performance protection on large files.

artifacts.summary: Research report analyzing compose buffer keymaps, identifying mapping priority issue with <leader>ms, and proposing 2-letter mapping scheme for compose actions
Full keybinding audit across all Himalaya environments with inconsistency analysis and unified mapping proposal
5-phase implementation plan for unified 2-letter compose buffer mappings
Implementation summary for compose buffer mapping refactor

active_projects.completion_summary: Refactored himalaya compose buffer mappings to use 2-letter scheme (<leader>me for send, <leader>md for draft, <leader>mq for quit), removing 3-letter <leader>mc* subgroup and resolving <leader>ms conflict between sync inbox and send email.

artifacts.summary: Research report analyzing TTS vs wezterm tab numbering mismatch with 3 solution options and implementation recommendation
3-phase implementation plan for global WezTerm tab numbering
Implementation summary for task 66

active_projects.completion_summary: Added global tab numbering to WezTerm so tab bar displays match TTS announcements. Implemented helper function using wezterm.mux.all_windows() with pcall fallback, updated wezterm-integration.md documentation.

artifacts.summary: Research report documenting folder table structure issue and keymap conflict with copy-paste ready fixes
1-phase plan fixing folder table handling in both move functions and removing <C-s> keymap
Implementation summary with verification results and technical details

active_projects.completion_summary: Fixed two task 64 regressions: move command now properly displays folder names (was showing 'table: 0x...') by extracting .name from folder table objects, and removed <C-s> keymap conflict in compose buffers (use <leader>mce instead).

artifacts.summary: Research report documenting 3 bugs with line-level fixes and verification that d/r/R errors are working as designed
2-phase implementation plan for 3 himalaya keymap bug fixes
Implementation summary with verification results

active_projects.completion_summary: Fixed 3 confirmed bugs in himalaya email plugin: added defensive nil check in move command format_item function, converted search keymaps from incorrect nvim_buf_set_keymap API to proper vim.keymap.set, and fixed compose send keymap to call correct send_email(buf) function.

artifacts.summary: Comprehensive analysis of himalaya sidebar keybindings, pagination issues, and preloading opportunities with implementation recommendations

Implementation summary with verification results

active_projects.completion_summary: Fixed himalaya sidebar pagination by replacing incorrect --offset CLI flag with correct -p (page) flag. Added error logging for async email fetch, implemented page preloading for faster navigation, and enhanced ? key notification with specific action key examples (<leader>med, <leader>mea, <leader>mer).

artifacts.summary: Research report identifying 4 issues: string format error, missing show_help, action key discoverability, preload delay optimization
4-phase plan: fix string format error, implement aggressive preloading (100ms delays), add show_help function, improve action key discoverability
Implementation summary with all changes and verification results

active_projects.completion_summary: Fixed 4 Himalaya post-task-59 issues: string format error for 1000+ folder counts, aggressive page preloading (50-100ms delays) for instant C-d/C-u pagination, show_help function for sidebar/compose contexts, and improved help messaging emphasizing <leader>me prefix for email actions.

artifacts.summary: Identified 6 delay sources in pagination flow including missing cache hit path, full UI refresh, and preload timing issues
5-phase plan implementing synchronous cache hit path, pre-rendered pages, and optimistic UI updates to achieve <16ms pagination latency
Implementation summary with cache architecture, flow diagrams, and performance targets

active_projects.completion_summary: Implemented page-level cache with synchronous lookup for instant pagination. Added pre-rendered display lines for < 16ms cache hit path, optimistic UI updates with silent background refresh, and generation-based staleness detection.

artifacts.summary: Root cause analysis: which-key calls non-existent functions in commands.email module
Research report with complete keymap analysis, function locations, conflict analysis, and copy-paste ready implementation code

Implementation summary with verification results

active_projects.completion_summary: Restored 8 single-letter action keymaps (d, a, r, R, f, m, c, /) to himalaya email list buffer. The ? key now shows the full folder help window. Selection-aware operations work correctly for batch delete, archive, and move.

artifacts.summary: Research report analyzing keymap implementation, root cause of errors, and recommended fixes for help menu
3-phase implementation plan to update help menu and footer with single-letter keymaps
Implementation summary with verification results

active_projects.completion_summary: Updated himalaya email sidebar help menu (gH) and footer to display single-letter quick action keymaps (r/R/f/d/a/m/c//) added in task 62. Help content now accurately reflects available actions.
